intro: Ruellia congoensis, commonly known as Congo bluebell, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ruellia congoensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
